Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was entered into primarily for immigration purposes or lacked genuineness
Credibility_Assessment: Marriage assessed as lacking genuine intent; wife's focus on immigration with son considered
Evidence_Type: Timing of marriage, limited interaction prior to marriage, communication patterns, immigration intentions
Legal_Provision: Subsection 4(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine and entered primarily for immigration purposes
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Haste of marriage, limited prior interaction, focus on immigration
Regulation_Cited: Subsection 4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Review_Outcome: IAD's finding on primary purpose upheld; finding on genuineness found unreasonable
Assessment_Standard: Objective assessment of marital genuineness and intent
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied in judicial review
Application_Factor: Marriage duration, cohabitation, financial interdependence, immigration motivation
Decision_Outcome: Sponsorship application denied; appeal dismissed; legal question certified
Decision_Review_Issue: Proper interpretation and application of subsection 4(1)
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Outcome_of_Review: Partial success: primary purpose upheld, genuineness finding set aside, legal question certified
Cause_of_Refusal: Marriage deemed primarily for immigration purposes
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Subjective intent inferred from objective circumstances
Credibility_Issues: Wife's credibility questioned regarding relationship authenticity
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, Subsection 4(1)
Procedural_Issue: Certification of a legal question for higher court consideration
Omission_Type: Failure to properly separate 'genuineness' from 'primary purpose' in analysis
